verses.plain: O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.

tokens.t: O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.

verses.plain: Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.

tokens.t: Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.

verses.plain: Thou hast shewed thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.

tokens.t: Thou hast shewed thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.

verses.plain: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.

tokens.t: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.

verses.plain: That thy beloved may be delivered; save with thy right hand, and hear me.

tokens.t: That thy beloved may be delivered; save
thy right hand, and hear me.

verses.plain: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

tokens.t: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

verses.plain: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;

tokens.t: Gilead
mine, and Manasseh
mine; Ephraim also
the strength of mine head; Judah
my lawgiver;

verses.plain: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.

tokens.t: Moab
my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.

verses.plain: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

tokens.t: Who will bring me
the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

verses.plain: Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off? and thou, O God, which didst not go out with our armies?

tokens.t: not thou, O God,
hadst cast us off? and
, O God,
didst not go out with our armies?

verses.plain: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

tokens.t: Give us help from trouble: for vain
the help of man.

verses.plain: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.

tokens.t: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he
shall tread down our enemies.

footnotes.text: triumph…: or, triumph thou over me: (by an irony)
help of man: Heb. salvation, etc
